div.p: SELFCONSTRUCTED is a sub-element within BIOGRAPHY PERSONNAME to capture names which a person chooses to uss in her everyday life, not only as her PSEUDONYM. As the element name suggests, these are names she applies to herself and, for example, writes on her cheques as well as signs her books with. Whereas a PSEUDONYM applies to a particular text or group of texts, SELFCONSTRUCTED signifies a name a writer elected to live by, like Maya Angelou or Hilary Mantel. It has optional attributes for NAMESIGNIFIER, REG, and WROTEORPUBLISHEDAS.

div.codeblock: SELFCONSTRUCTED WROTEORPUBLISHEDAS="WROTEPUBLISHEDASYES">Esther</SELFCONSTRUCTED><SCHOLARNOTE>HB published as Hester initially but later used Esther, possibly to align herself with the Old Testament form of the name.</SCHOLARNOTE>.

Brett

Dorothy Brett chose to call herself by one name only.
